content.body: changing that would be consistent with https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/3330 etc
So I *think* eliding all `is *true*` is possible without ambiguities. Mind you, some things don't read as well, so you'd probably want to do some renaming.
content.formatted_body: So I think eliding all is *true* is possible without ambiguities. Mind you, some things don't read as well, so you'd probably want to do some renaming.

content.body: anyway I definitely do not want to drop this everywhere
I am maybe pursuadable that we can drop it for specifically `If AO(...)` where AO is a predicate
content.formatted_body: I am maybe pursuadable that we can drop it for specifically If AO(...) where AO is a predicate

content.body: but personally I would be inclined not to
especially since there's not a good way to do the negated case
i also definitely do not want to drop this everywhere
i basically just want to drop it for `If IsFoo()`
content.formatted_body: i basically just want to drop it for If IsFoo()

content.body: Personally, I don't much like dropping it anywhere, but I think I can deal with it, so shrug.

Note that there are already 11 places in the spec where we elide `is *true*`. E.g. `It is a Syntax Error if the <sub>[Tagged]</sub> parameter was not set and |NoSubstitutionTemplate| Contains |NotEscapeSequence|.`
content.formatted_body: Note that there are already 11 places in the spec where we elide is *true*. E.g. It is a Syntax Error if the <sub>[Tagged]</sub> parameter was not set and |NoSubstitutionTemplate| Contains |NotEscapeSequence|.

content.body: Oh, I should have said earlier, I use a dynamic parsing algorithm, so it's possible for the grammar to have formal ambiguities that I don't know about, simply because the current pseudocode doesn't encounter them.
btw I will have to leave editor call tomorrow at 15:00
@shuyuguo:matrix.org we can start a half hour earlier if you like and are free, otherwise we'll just have to do 30 minutes
